Kirk, this program looks really cool but it crashes for me right 
after it =
starts up.  It manages to show the initial screen (I see 
Pac Man on the bo=
ard) but then says "PMAI.exe has encountered a 
problem and needs to close.=
  We are sorry for the inconvenience."

The error signature is:

AppName: p=
mai.exe	 AppVer: 0.0.0.0	 ModName: pmai.exe
ModVer: 0.0.0.0	 Offset: 0001af=
88

I don't know what's causing this.  Is it possibly missing a dll or 
som=
ething like that?  I wonder if I'm the only one with this problem.

ken


-=
-- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "newtwist2000" <rkdelisle@...> wrote:
>
> I hav=
e just finished posting my entry into the NEAT world:  
> https://sourcefor=
ge.net/projects/aipac
> 
> AIPac (or PacAI - I tend to swap them) is a prog=
ram that evolves a 
> controller for PacMan using NEAT.  I tried to develop=
 the code as 
> flexibly as possible and the result allows control over the=
 mazes, 
> character positions, graphics, etc.  I think it is reasonably 
>=
 flexible enough for some interesting experiments.  These details 
as 
> we=
ll as NEAT parameters are controlled through a parameter file.
> 
> Current=
ly, the inputs to the net are defined as a window centered 
on 
> PacMan an=
d extending 6 tiles in each direction.  The result is a 
> 13x13 window wit=
hin which there are independent inputs for walls, 
> dots, empty space, and=
 ghosts of various flavors.  There's also an 
> example (WMV) of the best r=
un I've seen thus far using this scheme.
> 
> Please head over to SourceFor=
ge and give it a run.  If you have 
any 
> problems, post in the Forums at =
SourceForge.
> 
> -Kirk
>
